answers.answer: Being diabetic can cause neuropathy (loss or abnormal nerve sensation, esp. to the feet).As you probably know, smoking and drinking is not healthy for anyone, but esp. people with chronic diseases like diabetes and high BP.  The smoking constricts your blood flow to your vessels including your legs.Why was the vein in your left foot removed?How long ago was the last time you had doppler studies done?  If it has been more than a year, you need another one, and if your symptoms have changed, you need another one.I don't think you need pain killers since this sounds more like a nerve problem.  If you doctors have "given up on you," then get another one.  You need medial attention, but you also need to make some lifestyle changes to improve your health.Call to make an appt. to see a doctor to get this worked up.
